snippet: The numbers bolstered economists’ belief that seasonal fluctuations caused a steep drop in employment growth in March.
abstract: Labor Department reports that weekly claims for unemployment benefits fell 42,000, to seasonally adjusted 346,000; figure eases fears of marked deterioration in labor market after surprise stumble in job growth in March.
lead_paragraph: The numbers bolstered economists’ belief that seasonal fluctuations caused a steep drop in employment growth in March.

headline.seo: Drop in Jobless Claims Counteracts March Data
headline.main: Drop in Jobless Claims Counteracts March Data
headline.print_headline: Drop in Jobless Claims Counteracts March Data
